actor_awards.notes: A member of the 'Rat Pack', Lawford was known for his charm, aristocratic persona, and connection to the Kennedy family (he was John F. Kennedy's brother-in-law). He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1960.

filmography.title: Mrs. Miniver
filmography.role_description: The idealistic son of the Miniver family who joins the Royal Air Force to fight in World War II.
filmography.plot: A British family struggles to survive the first months of World War II.

filmography.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
filmography.role_description: A friend of Dorian Gray who becomes concerned about his behavior and moral decay.
filmography.plot: A corrupt young man somehow keeps his youthful beauty eternally, but a special painting gradually reveals his inner ugliness to all.

filmography.title: Little Women
filmography.role_description: The charming and wealthy boy next door who becomes the close friend of the March sisters.
filmography.plot: The four March sisters grow up in New England during the Civil War.

filmography.title: Ocean's 11
filmography.role_description: A member of Danny Ocean's gang who helps execute the heist of five Las Vegas casinos.
filmography.plot: Danny Ocean gathers a group of his World War II compatriots to pull off the ultimate Las Vegas heist.

filmography.title: Easter Parade
filmography.role_description: A wealthy friend of Don Hewes who inadvertently becomes a romantic rival.
filmography.plot: A nightclub performer hires a naive chorus girl to become his new partner to make his former partner jealous.

filmography.title: The Longest Day
filmography.role_description: The commander of the 1st Special Service Brigade who lands at Sword Beach on D-Day with his bagpiper.
filmography.plot: The events of D-Day, told on a grand scale from both the Allied and German points of view.

filmography.title: Good News
filmography.role_description: A popular college football hero who falls for a studious girl.
filmography.plot: A college football hero falls for a studious girl who helps him study so he can play in the big game.

filmography.title: Royal Wedding
filmography.role_description: A British aristocrat who falls in love with an American dancer played by Jane Powell.
filmography.plot: Brother and sister dance act Tom and Ellen Bowen travel to London in 1947 when the royal wedding is capturing the public's imagination.

filmography.title: Advise & Consent
filmography.role_description: A playboy senator who becomes involved in the fierce political battle over a Secretary of State nomination.
filmography.plot: A controversy swirls around the President's nominee for Secretary of State, leading to blackmail and political maneuvering in the Senate.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nomination – Palme d'Or

filmography.title: It Should Happen to You
filmography.role_description: A wealthy soap manufacturer who romances a woman seeking fame.
filmography.plot: A woman seeking fame rents a billboard with her name on it, attracting the attention of a soap manufacturer and a documentary filmmaker.

filmography.title: Exodus
filmography.role_description: A British officer in Cyprus who is sympathetic to the Jewish refugees but bound by his orders.
filmography.plot: The state of Israel is founded in 1948 after a group of Jewish refugees are spirited out of British Mandate Palestine.

filmography.title: Dead Ringer
filmography.role_description: The deceitful lover of a woman who murders her twin sister and assumes her identity.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman is murdered by her poor twin sister, who then takes over her identity.

filmography.title: Son of Lassie
filmography.role_description: The owner of Lassie's son, Laddie, who becomes an RAF flyer during WWII.
filmography.plot: Lassie's son Laddie, considered a failure as a war dog, stows away on a bomber and parachutes into Nazi-occupied Norway.

filmography.title: The White Cliffs of Dover
filmography.role_description: The son of an American woman living in England who grows up to fight in WWII.
filmography.plot: An American woman travels to England in 1914, meets a baronet, loses him in WWI, and raises her son to fight in WWII.

filmography.title: Cluny Brown
filmography.role_description: A charming and idealistic young man who becomes infatuated with the unconventional Cluny Brown.
filmography.plot: An amateur plumber and a Czech refugee writer meet in England before WWII and upset the social order.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: It Happened in Brooklyn
filmography.role_description: A shy English composer and aristocrat who befriends a group of musicians in Brooklyn.
filmography.plot: An ex-GI tries to become a singer in Brooklyn, aided by a janitor and a music teacher.

filmography.title: Buona Sera, Mrs. Campbell
filmography.role_description: One of three American soldiers who may be the father of an Italian woman's daughter.
filmography.plot: During a reunion of his squadron in Italy, a man tries to find out if he is the father of a local woman's daughter.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress (Gina Lollobrigida)

filmography.title: Salt and Pepper
filmography.role_description: A London club owner who, along with his partner, gets mixed up in espionage.
filmography.plot: Two hip London club owners are dragged into a plot to overthrow the British government.

filmography.title: One More Time
filmography.role_description: Lawford reprises his role and plays his character's aristocratic twin brother in this sequel directed by Jerry Lewis.
filmography.plot: Two club owners get involved in a diamond smuggling ring after one assumes the identity of his deceased twin brother.

filmography.title: Never So Few
filmography.role_description: A medical officer and friend to Frank Sinatra's character during WWII in Burma.
filmography.plot: A hard-bitten American captain takes command of a band of Kachin guerrillas in Burma during World War II.

filmography.title: Sergeants 3
filmography.role_description: A cavalry sergeant in this 'Rat Pack' western remake of Gunga Din.
filmography.plot: Three cavalry sergeants and a trumpet player team up to stop a group of fanatics from seizing the West.

filmography.title: The Oscar
filmography.role_description: A Hollywood agent who helps a ruthless actor climb to the top.
filmography.plot: An unscrupulous actor uses everyone around him to advance his career and secure an Oscar nomination.

filmography.title: Harlow
filmography.role_description: The MGM producer who marries Jean Harlow but commits suicide shortly after.
filmography.plot: A biographical drama about the life and tragic death of 1930s screen siren Jean Harlow.

filmography.title: Julia Misbehaves
filmography.role_description: A painter who falls in love with the daughter of the title character.
filmography.plot: A showgirl returns to her estranged husband for their daughter's wedding and causes chaos.

filmography.title: On an Island with You
filmography.role_description: A naval officer who kidnaps a movie star to fly her to the island where they first met.
filmography.plot: A movie star goes to Hawaii and gets involved in a romantic triangle with a naval officer and her co-star.

filmography.title: Please Believe Me
filmography.role_description: A millionaire playboy who courts a woman who has inherited a Texas ranch.
filmography.plot: Three men pursue a woman who has inherited a ranch, not realizing that the ranch is worthless.

filmography.title: They Only Kill Their Masters
filmography.role_description: A police captain in this mystery film involving a Doberman Pinscher.
filmography.plot: A police chief investigates the death of a woman, with her Doberman as the prime suspect.

filmography.title: Skidoo
filmography.role_description: A corrupt senator in this psychedelic comedy.
filmography.plot: A retired hitman is forced back into duty by a mob boss to silence an informant in prison.

filmography.title: The Red Danube
filmography.role_description: A British officer in post-war Vienna who falls in love with a Russian ballerina.
filmography.plot: A British colonel in Vienna must deal with Soviet attempts to repatriate refugees, including a ballerina.

filmography.title: Rogue's March
filmography.role_description: A British officer wrongly accused of treason who re-enlists as a private to clear his name.
filmography.plot: A British officer is framed for espionage and joins the regiment as a private to find the real traitor.
